content:
Office Memorandum . UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT
Mr. B. T. Potter, P/SP
DATE: May 24. 1962
FROM : W. A. Fagan, ID SUBJECT: CUSA's memo dated May 18, 1962, Ref: C2-62-1572
Referring to subject memo, all papers returned.
The attached letter, you will note, cites JGW as recommend- ing and requests Mission's concurrence, However, JGW did not recommend, it merely reviewed the requests of the Kaohsiung and Keelung Harbor Bureans | considered the requested allocations to be effective utilization of the equipment and referred the matter to CUSA for its action. As a result, before I will concur in this, or any subsequent, paper, CUSA must state its approval to the suggested allocations.
General Comments :
1. CUSA should be requested to inform the Mission with respect to items on sheets marked with a red %". As you Will mate, in osch instance, both KARB and KIHB are listed as recipients for the full quantity available, Who is to get what ?
2. The crane, shovel, CED, serial 22114 (see clipped Sheet), marked for allocation to KIHB, is listed at requiring "considerable repaira. " As I question the wisdom of bringing such a piece of equipment to Taiwan. I believe. CUSA should state in writing that it wishes this item, in its present condition, procured for KIHB and that the costs for placing it in an operable condi- tion shall be KIHB's sole responsibility. In other words, bo aid financing for sparo parts, et0.
Attachments
azi√• Academia Isterica
314

Referring to subject memo, all papers returned.

The attached letter, you will note, cites JGW as recommend- ing and requests Mission's concurrence, However, JGW did not recommend, it merely reviewed the requests of the Kaohsiung and Keelung Harbor Bureans | considered the requested allocations to be effective utilization of the equipment and referred the matter to CUSA for its action. As a result, before I will concur in this, or any subsequent, paper, CUSA must state its approval to the suggested allocations.

1. CUSA should be requested to inform the Mission with respect to items on sheets marked with a red %". As you Will mate, in osch instance, both KARB and KIHB are listed as recipients for the full quantity available, Who is to get what ?

2. The crane, shovel, CED, serial 22114 (see clipped Sheet), marked for allocation to KIHB, is listed at requiring "considerable repaira. " As I question the wisdom of bringing such a piece of equipment to Taiwan. I believe. CUSA should state in writing that it wishes this item, in its present condition, procured for KIHB and that the costs for placing it in an operable condi- tion shall be KIHB's sole responsibility. In other words, bo aid financing for sparo parts, et0.
